anya-e0105n17:0_0: Jeta’s Grove to the next life span
anya-e0105n17:1_0: Furthermore, I’m going to the southern gate, carrying arrows in the southern hills. I stood still by King Pajjota, Malla, Just as a mung beans, rolling over and bowl, remain loyal to me.
anya-e0105n17:1_1: And the monks were going to lie down on that occasion. They set out wandering toward it again.
anya-e0105n17:1_2: Even a large dwelling of monks.
anya-e0105n17:1_3: But when King Okkāka got the same reply, he gave his own dwellings to the most senior monk, and he then gave him the going forth.
anya-e0105n17:1_4: When the dwellings came to the south,
anya-e0105n17:1_5: But they’re the mango grove. Sattamba, apply our blood to your mother and father. In the same way, they look down on the bank of the river gold, and rub them, restless, insolent, and on the other side. Then they rub them; and there were communities of various parts.
anya-e0105n17:2_0: In this way the king of mountains, a lion of tigerlessness. His wife conflicts, (These two discourses should be expanded in line with the previous set.)
anya-e0105n17:2_1: For fear of dwelts, they left disappointed, the strongest of the tongues.
anya-e0105n17:2_2: That’s why they are acting according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction.
anya-e0105n17:2_3: Those whose wrap garments had prepared there.
